brief: One big number in the socio-economic caste census is 2.37 crore. This is the tally of rural households that lives in dwellings with “one or less room, kuccha walls and kuccha roof".
title: 2.37cr people still living in kuccha homes

brief: Data from the SECC on asset ownership of ru ral households shows the stark reality of India's countryside. Motorised vehicles, telephones, refrigerators and agricultural equipment are a dream for most of our rural population.
title: Owning cars still a dream for many

brief: America’s second largest automaker Ford is shifting focus from Detroit to Silicon Valley as it plays catch up to technology innovations in the fast-changing mobility space.
title: Ford puts self-driving car project in fast lane

brief: Subhash Umaranikar, (42), resides in Navi Mumbai with his wife Vaishali (36), son Prajwal (15) and daughter Pranjali (8). Subhash works for the government while Vaishali is a homemaker.
title: Wealth creation is like running a marathon
